intro: Sempervivum marmoreum subsp. marmoreum, commonly known as the Marble Cactus, is a succulent plant native to the Pyrenees Mountains. It features rosettes of fleshy, blue-green leaves with distinctive white or pinkish markings. The plant produces tall, flowering stalks that bear clusters of small, pink or purple flowers. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its compact size and ornamental appearance make it a desirable addition to both indoor and outdoor gardens.
